snippet: In spite of soaring costs, canceled contracts and blown deadlines, the Pentagon and the Obama administration see the Littoral Combat Ship as naval warfare’s future.
abstract: Obama administration and the Pentagon are embracing the Littoral Combat Ship as the future of naval warfare, in spite of soaring costs, canceled contracts and blown deadlines; able to operate on the high seas and along shallow coastlines (the 'littorals'), the fast, maneuverable ship is central to Pres Obama’s strategy of projecting American power in the Pacific and the Persian Gulf. (Series: The Next War)
